description: Number of ways of writing n = p+c with p prime and c nonprime (1 or a composite number).
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
example: n = 22 has floor(n/2) = 11 partitions of form n = a + b; 3 partitions are of prime + prime [3 + 19 = 5 + 17 = 11 + 11], 3 partitions are of prime + nonprime [2 + 20 = 7 + 15 = 13 + 9], 5 partitions are nonprime + nonprime [1 + 21 = 4 + 18 = 6 + 16 = 8 + 14 = 10 + 12]. So a(22) = 3.
